p: Viruses: Flaviviruses, belonging to the Flaviviridae family, are enveloped, non-segmented, single-stranded and positive-sense RNA viruses. Their genome of approximately 11 kb encodes three structural proteins (capsid C, preMembrane prM and Envelop E) and seven non-structural proteins (NS1, NS2A, NS2B, NS3, NS4A, NS4B, and NS5) involved in virus replication and counteractive of immune responses ( Figure 1). Notably, flaviviruses belonging to the Japanese Encephalitis serocomplex (such as WNV, Japanese, Saint-Louis and Murray Valley encephalitis viruses) express an additional non-structural protein, NS1′, resulting from ribosomal frameshift occurring at a specific heptanucleotide motif close to the beginning of the NS2A gene [ 112]. Even though the precise functions of NS1′ are still largely unknown, this protein has been involved in virus neuroinvasiveness.
